intro: Actephila excelsa, commonly known as the tall actephila, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Actephila excelsa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
